introduction.name: Austin Green
introduction.description: I am currently a Senior at Kansas State University. I will be graduation in the Spring of 2016 with a Bachelors of Engineering in Software Engineering with a minor in Business. I enjoy finding unique solutions to common problems with an emphasis on scalable web and mobile.

experiences.name: Kansas State University
experiences.subText: Senior with a 3.60 cumulative GPA. Graduating in Spring 2016.

involvement.description: Graduated with a degree in Computer Science - Software Engineering with a minor in Business.
Focus in scalable web and mobile technologies.
Vice-President, RLC Chairman, Homecoming, and Recruitment Chairman of the Kansas State Chapter of the Delta Chi Fraternity.
1st place in the CIS Department and 2nd overall in Engineering for developing a web-based responsive recruitment display for the Spring 2014 Engineering Open House.

experiences.name: Delphix
experiences.subText: Software Engineer Front-End Development Team.  Starting August 2016.
experiences.description: Design and implement front-end solutions for the Delphix DAAS platform.

involvement.description: Starting in August 2016.

experiences.name: Garmin International
experiences.subText: Web-based aviation and fitness applications. May 2015 - August 2015
experiences.description: Created web-based, code analysis tools to streamline development and engineering efficiency

involvement.description: Developed AngularJS and D3.js based code analysis tools to visualize codebase and find deficiencies
Create custom Jenkins addon to integrate the web-based visualization tool into their CI environment
Developed ConnectIQ fitness wearable applications that leveraged the Google Distance Matrix, Places, and Directions API's along with node.js and socket.io to provide real-time directions.

experiences.technologies: Javascript, TypeScript, AngularJS, D3.js, less, socket.io, node.js, mysql, monkey-c, boost-build, Jenkins CI, Java

experiences.name: TAF Technologies LLC
experiences.description: Design and implement iOS and web based technologies for bluetooth enabled track and field devices

involvement.description: Communicated with stakeholders to design and plan product release cycle.
Developed a native iOS application to communicate, control, and modify BLE enabled track and field sensors.
Developed scalable web application to allow cross-device access to athlete information and allow large-scale data analysis.

experiences.technologies: Swift, Objective-C, JavaScript (node.js), AngularJS, PostgreSQL, AWS Technologies

experiences.name: GTM Sportswear
experiences.subText: Examine, extend, and create backend .net web applications. August 2014 - Present
experiences.description: Automated accounting concepts and created internal and external tools for OEMs and customers

Work with office and production personnel to create tools that increase their efficiency and profits.
Developed and managed both front and back-end web applications for public and internal applications.

experiences.technologies: VB.net, C#, t-sql, SQL Server Profiler, Infor Smart Office Inventory Management System

experiences.name: Beyond the Scores
experiences.subText: Web Development and Software Design. March 2013 - August 2014
experiences.description: Design and develop large-scale, real-time web applications.

involvement.description: Developed sports management software to help the management and creation of Gymnastics teams and leagues.
Created a pet weighing kiosk for PetStep (Petco) that collects user and animal data.
Work with clients and partners to create systems that solve their unique issues.

experiences.name: CIS Department Webmaster
experiences.subText: Web Development and System Administration. December 2013 - August 2014
experiences.description: Develop web applications, recruitment strategies, and maintain existing resources of the Computing and Information Sciences Department at Kansas State University.

involvement.description: Create web applications that help students manage their information with the University and inside the Department.
Work with office personnel and recruitment staff to develop new ways to interact with future students and increase enrollment.

Created iOS and Android applications using the Ionic framework to interface with the new inventory system.

experiences.name: Kansas State Research and Extension
experiences.subText: Technical Support and System Administration. August 2012 - December 2013
experiences.description: Provided technical support and programming solutions for over 150 counties and offices.

involvement.description: Operated as a high-level support technician that provided IT support for the Kansas State Research and Extensions offices and University Printing.
Was able to reduce ticket completion time by 40% by creating and implementing new strategies for local and remote technicians to respond to issues.
Automated software deployment for new machines to decrease completion times from 2.5 hours to 30 minutes.
